intro: Glochidion kerangae, commonly known as the Kerangae glabrous leaf vine, is a species of flowering plant in the family Euphorbiaceae. It is native to the Philippines and is characterized by its small, glabrous leaves and inconspicuous flowers. The plant typically grows as a shrub or vine, often found in lowland rainforests and secondary forests. Its fruits are small capsules that contain several seeds, which are dispersed by wind or animals. Glochidion kerangae plays a role in local ecosystems by providing habitat and food for various insect species.
